str2: A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Acceptable, well-pleasing (especially to God), grateful. From eu and arestos; fully agreeable.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
